intro: Diosma meyeriana, commonly known as Meyer's diosma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale pink, appearing in late spring to early summer. Diosma meyeriana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
